verbose_text: ChR2 or ChETA activation was induced by light flashes on cortical slices, using a 20 mW LED (lambda = 470 nm, Cairn research, UK) collimated and coupled to the epifluorescence path of a Zeiss AxioExaminer microscope, using a 40X water immersion (N.A. 1) lens.
evidence: ChETA activation was induced by light flashes on cortical slices, using a 20 mW
